trans-unit.source: Represents a read-only collection that can contain many different types of permissions.
Read-only permission sets are created from explicit XML and cannot be modified after creation.
This restriction ensures that the permission set will be restored to the same XML encoding that it was originally created from.
Attempting to add or remove a permission from the <xref:System.Security.ReadOnlyPermissionSet> results in an <xref:System.InvalidOperationException>.
Note that any permission you obtain from the <xref:System.Security.ReadOnlyPermissionSet> is only a copy of the permission.
If the copy is mutable and is changed, the permission that is in the <xref:System.Security.ReadOnlyPermissionSet> is not changed.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Security.ReadOnlyPermissionSet"></xref> class.
The XML element from which to take the value of the new <xref href="System.Security.ReadOnlyPermissionSet"></xref>.
permissionSetXml is `null`.
Creates a copy of the <xref href="System.Security.ReadOnlyPermissionSet"></xref>.
A copy of the read-only permission set.
Reconstructs a security object with a specified state from an XML encoding.

This override of <xref:System.Security.PermissionSet.FromXml%2A?displayProperty=fullName> is intended to be called by the base class <xref:System.Security.PermissionSet> when it is deserializing the permission set.
An exception is thrown if you attempt to call <xref:System.Security.ReadOnlyPermissionSet.FromXml%2A> directly.
You cannot modify a read-only permission set with a <xref:System.Security.ReadOnlyPermissionSet.FromXml%2A> call.
The XML encoding to use to reconstruct the security object.
The et parameter is `null`.
The et parameter is not a valid permission element.
-or-
The et parameter's version number is not supported.

The object is not being deserialized; that is, <xref href="System.Security.PermissionSet"></xref> did not call back into <xref href="System.Security.ReadOnlyPermissionSet.FromXml(System.Security.SecurityElement)"></xref> during deserialization.
Gets a value that indicates whether the collection is read-only.
A <xref:System.Security.ReadOnlyPermissionSet> is always read-only, so this value must always be `true`.
Always `true`.
Creates an XML encoding of the security object and its current state.
An XML encoding of the security object, including any state information.
